[12 & 13 G-eo. 5.] War Charges (Validity). draft of a.BILLtoMake valid certain charges imposed and levies a.d. 1922. made during the late War.WHEREAS during the late "War certain Departments of the Crown purporting to act in the execution of duties imposed, and in pursuance of powers conferred upon them by the Defence of the Realm Regulations, 5 Orders made under those Regulations, or otherwise, imposed, or purported to impose, directly or indirectly, certain charges either by way of payments required to be made on, or as a condition of, the grant of licences issued in pursuance of the said powers, or by way of 10 payments reqiiired to be made in connection with the control of the supplies of certain commodities, and there-after levied certain of the sums payable or alleged to be payable by virtue of the said charges, but certain of the said sums remained unpaid at the commencement of this 15 Act:And whereas the power in law of the said Depart-ments to impose the said charges, or certain of them, and to levy the said, sums, or certain of them, has been called in question, and it is expedient that validity should be 20 given to the said charges and levies :Be it therefore enacted by the King's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this169-2 war Charges ( Validity). [12 & 13 Geo. 5.]A.D. 1922, present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows : -Validity of 1. (1) The imposition of the charges aforesaid andcertain war ]ie levying of the sums thereby charged shall be and w 5eS and shall be deemed always to have been valid in law, and 5 accoruingly (a) any sums so charged but not levied or paid before before the commencement of this Act may be recovered as debts due to His Majesty ; and(6) no proceedings whatsoever shall be instituted by 10 any person in any court of law or before any other tribunal whatsoever for the repayment to him of any sums so levied as aforesaid, or for compensation in respect of the making of any such levy, and if any such proceedings have 15 been instituted before the commencement of this Act and are pending at that date, they shall be discharged and made void:Provided that-(i) where any proceedings have before the com- 20 mencement of this Act been instituted by any person for the repayment to him of any sums so levied as aforesaid, and are pending at that date, the court or the tribunal dealing with the case may, notwithstanding anything in 25 this Act, make such order as to costs as it thinks just; and(ii) nothing in this Act shall apply to charges imposed in connection with licences issued under the Milk (Distribution) Order, 1918, and 30 the Milk (Registration of Dealers) Amend-ment Order, 1918, in relation to milk produced in the South Western Area as defined for the purposes of those Orders.Short title. 2. This Act may be cited as. the War Charges 35(Validity) Act, 1922, . .
